description: For sale in our St. Louis showroom is a striking 1965 Mercury Comet Caliente. Caliente which translates to "Red Hot" in spanish, and just so happens to be perfect for this 65' Comet. Powered by a Roush built 289 CID V8 that produces 305 horsepower and 317 ft-lb of torque. Options for this 1965 Mercury Comet Caliente include: AM Radio, Power Steering, Tilt Wheel, Seat Belts, Vinyl Interior, Radial Tires, and Magnum 500 Aluminum/Alloy Wheels. Only 50 miles has been put on this 65' Comet since the completion of this beautiful restoration. A Holley 600 CFM carburetor sits atop the Roush built 289 CID V8 which also features an Edelbrock billet fuel filter and braided line, an MSD Pro-Billet distributor, an ARP head and main bolts, and of course the Roush signature valve covers and air filter. The block was bored and honed .030 over, the reconditioned heads underwent a 3 angle valve job, and were reassembled with new stainless steel valves and premium hardware including hydraulic roller springs. The crankshaft was also reconditioned to a grind variance of .010"/.010" and balance rotating assembly. The final assembly of the engine was complete with Comp Cams small base circle hydraulic roller cam and tie bar lifters, Ford Motorsport timing set, Scorpion roller rocker arms, Wiseco forged pistons, Eagle 4340 H-beam rods, Melling high volume oil pump, Canton Racing Products 8 qt. road race oil pan and pickup tube, and an Edelbrock Performer RPM intake manifold. The custom ceramic coated headers look amazing and run to the full 2 1/2 inch stainless steel exhaust for an awesome sound.  A 4 speed Top Loader transmission with a Hurst shifter featuring a hydraulic clutch has been employed to transfer the power to the new 9" Curric limited Posi-Trac rear end assembly which features the Performance Axle Package and a 3.50 gear ratio. Wilwood 4 wheel disc brakes not only look amazing but they do an excellent job of stopping this resto-mod when needed. The front suspension features powder coated tubular A-arm and coil overs, with coil overs in the rear suspension as well this Caliente Comet handles like a dream. The re-chromed front and rear bumpers with the all new chrome and stainless trim looks phenomenal against the masterful black paint. The interior of this Beautiful Comet was is just as nice as the outside and engine bay. The black with red trim vinyl interior looks like it has never been sat in and is a perfect complement to the build. To view this 1965 Mercury Caliente Comet in greater detail including HD pictures and an HD video visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com or our St. Louis showroom. For more information please call 618-271-3000 or email STL@GatewayClassicCars.comThe good ones go fast, call now for availability!
title: 1965 Mercury Comet

description: 1967 Mercury Cougar Restomod    VIN: KS134219    Check out this beautiful Nut & Bolt restored Mercury Cougar Restomod. This car was restored by the previous owner who owned the car since 1987! The engine was built by Lawrence Racing in Westhampton, New York. The Ford 428 FE Block is tied to a Richmond Overdrive 6 Speed Manual Transmission. The Black Paint Shines and the Leather Custom Bucket seats inside are BEAUTIFUL.  There was no expense spared in this restoration and every detail was done down to the nut & bolts. This car was built to perform and she does! This car has A/C and a hood-scoop so your engine can cool down as well, perfect for summer.  Come Check out this Dream and see how fast she can go!      Included in Sale:  - Photos   - Engine Spec Sheet   - Highlight Sheet  - Invoices & Receipts     Go to www.vanguardmotorsales.com to see over 100 HD photos and our in-depth video for this 1967 Mercury Cougar and over 200 other classics!    Mechanics:  -     Ford 428ci V8 Cobra Jet Block  Engine built by: Lawrence Racing Engines in Westhampton, N.Y.  Cobra Jet Crankshaft and Rods  Edelbrock Aluminum Heads  12.5:1 Forged Pistons (11.5:1 static compression w/ heads)  Crower Camshaft (298 degrees duration w/ .560 lift)  850 CFM Carb  Ford Aluminum Police Interceptor Intake  MSD Ignition System  Ford Dura Spark Distributor Converted w/ Light Advance Springs  Comp Cams Roller Rocker Assembly  Canton Oil Pan  Block was Magnifluxed, Line Bored, Decked for Squareness and Bored .30 Over  Crank was Cut .010 and Oil Holes Opened up (also magnifluxed)  Rods were Checked for Straightness and Re-Sized  Rotating Assembly was Balanced to Within 1 Gram  Comp Cams Roller Rocker Assembly w/ Hardened Shafts  Motor was Broken-In On Dyno, Oil Changed, Valves Adjusted then Run 3 Times for a Best of 512hp at 6,000 rpm  Holley Single 4 Barrel (#C7AE9425-F)  - CFM:850  - Mechanical Secondaries  - Double Pumper  - Police Interceptor Aluminum Intake  Richmond Overdrive 6 Speed Manual Transmission  - .67 Overdrive   - Explosion Proof Bel-housing   - Left Side of Trans (#71-68111)  - Right Side of Trans (#71-68112)  Total Control Rack & Pinion Steering Kit  720 lb. Front Springs  5 - Leaf Rear Springs  Total Control Upper and Lower Tubular Control Arms  Monte Carlo Bar and Shock Tower Bars Installed  Front Suspension: Independent  - Fully Adjustable   - 1 1/8 Sway Bar  - Canton Oil Pan  Rear Suspension: Leaf Spring  Ford 9 Rear End  - Gear Ratio: 4:10:1  - Trac - Lock  Baer Racing Brakes:   - Front â€“  Disc  - Rear â€“  Disc  Exhaust: Dual Exhaust  - No Name Flowmaster Style Mufflers  - 3 in. Exhaust    Key Components:  - A/C  - Power Steering  - Aluminum Radiator   - Poli-Stainless Gas Stank   - Mechanical Clutch   - Fully Functional Horn  - Voltage, Speedo, Tac, Water Temp, Fuel Gauge on Dash  - Manual Fan Switch  - Brand New Brake Lines  - Indicator Lights  - Brand New Shocks  - Drive Shaft Loop  - Fuel Pump Switch  - Ignition Switch  - Auto Meter Gauges  - JVC CD/AM

description: Nicely maintained rust free car that runs and drives beautifully! This car is in its stock configuration with a Y Block V8 engine and optional automatic transmission, power brakes, dual exhaust, excellent condition upholstery, carpets headliner, operating clear windows, operating door locks, speedometer, fuel, oil pressure, and engine temperature gauges all function properly.   The exterior paint is approximately 7 year old repaint using the original colors and is in good condition, the chrome and bright work are in fair condition showing some pitting.    The car is in overall very good condition with the exception of a slight exhaust manifold leak at the time of this writing.  This car is very reliable and could be driven daily and at freeway speeds or used as a weekend toy.    Financing is available with approved credit, world wide delivery services are also available.
